sources.title: Suspended Alibi
sources.description: Title: Suspended Alibi Summary: A married editor who is having an affair pretends that he is visiting an army friend, to keep his wife from suspecting him of infidelity. But while he is with the girlfriend, his friend is ... Directed by: Alfred Shaughnessy Actors: Patrick Holt, Honor Blackman, Valentine Dyall Production Company: Association of Cinema Technicians (A.C.T.) Release Date: February 1957 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.85 : 1 A married editor who is having an affair pretends that he is visiting an army friend, to keep his wife from suspecting him of infidelity. But while he is with the girlfriend, his friend is murdered, and the editor is suspected of the crime.

metadata.Plot: A married editor who is having an affair pretends that he is visiting an army friend, to keep his wife from suspecting him of infidelity. But while he is with the girlfriend, his friend is murdered, and the editor is suspected of the crime.
metadata.Writer: Robert Dunbar, Kenneth R. Hayles, Alfred Shaughnessy
metadata.Actors: Patrick Holt, Honor Blackman, Valentine Dyall
